website_summaries.verdict: Honeywell's Siri-, Alexa-, and geofencing-enabled Lyric T5 is smart, it works well and it offers a better value than other connected thermostats.
pros: The $150 Honeywell Lyric T5's geofencing feature worked consistently well, it automated my Home and Away settings every time without complaint, and it sent prompt notifications alerting me to the changes
cons: While I like the thermostat's general design, the font and layout of the touchscreen interface looks dated
I would like to see integrations with Google Home, Samsung SmartThings, Wink and IFTTT

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Nest Gen2 I replaced IMO
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Nest Gen 2 in order to get the apply HomeKit and Siri compatibility. My Favorite feature is Siri voice commands and the Geofencing. It’s not as attractive as the Nest was, but the learning feature Nest had was running up my utility bills. We never had a predictable lifestyle so the Lyric geofencing is a much better solution. Scheduling is also WAY easier on this. If you have Apple products you want this over the Nest. The Ecobee looked good too,but this is less and I couldn’t be happier. I was planning on giving the Nest to my in-laws, but now I think I’ll sell that in ebay and get them this for less money.
customer_reviews.author: ASHLEIGH WOMACK

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money! Don’t Buy Honeywell Smart Thermostats!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this thermostat installed for approximately 8 months and it constantly disconnects and cannot find the Honeywell servers. Honeywell has a long way to go ... too many server issues which negates the themostat’s “smart” features. Honeywell also has poor customer service in that they do not follow up on reported issues. I’ve made multiple calls to customer service and sent tweets to their Twitter customer service and the “server issue” still isn’t resolved. I’m going with Ecobee and will not buy another Honeywell product again. Save your money. Don’t buy Honeywell.
customer_reviews.author: ralexa

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for Nest
customer_reviews.text: Needed customer service to walk me through installation. I needed to hook up the blue common wire at my furnace. The tech troubleshot the problem and had me running in a few minutes. Setup on app was easy and works fine with Siri on iPhone. Previously device was a Nest that stopped working. So far this does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Caused a 500$ electric bill
customer_reviews.text: I am a certified HVAC technician and have installed many z-wave thermostats and yet could not get this one to connect and then after a few days the system started not cooling properly and upon further inspection I found that the blower was running constantly which has led to me having a 500.00$!!!! electric bill. I wasnt able to get the device installed when I first recieved it due to deaths in the family and now I am left with an expensive paper weight. This product is garbage
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable WiFi connection
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I’m a retired engineer who enjoys technical challenges, so I have a lot of patience with getting tech items working correctly. I’ve been “playing” with this thermostat for just under 1-1/2 years. I give up! When I finally get it connected to our WiFi, it randomly disconnects and will not reconnect. I broke down and bought a Google Nest Thermostat E. Easy to install, easy to configure, and ...... IT WORKS! Very disappointed in my old favorite Honeywell for thermostats. Hate to see the old companies struggle and fail with the new home automation stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Geofencing does not appropriately work
customer_reviews.text: Geofencing sucks. It barely works. I have switched to a schedule as working with the customer service for over a year still will not get it to work well. Have even tried switching out thermostats and the Geofencing still doesn't work. I get the feeling that Honeywell just hopes that it will work enough to keep most people from checking the list of when it registers people leaving and arriving the "Home" area. Very upset about the waste of money and time that I have put into trying to make this work.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: App and Software could be updated
customer_reviews.text: This has replaced an brand new - sub par thermostat in my brand new apartment complex. However, this product doesn't seem to enjoy connecting to the WiFi whatsoever. I have tried over 50 times to get it working, 2 of which said it was complete. Of those 2, the device couldn't finish its setup and I had to restart. Very disappointing with Honeywell, since I know they're a better company than this. UPDATE Finally have this item up and running. Issues were the compatibility of the app to my devices. Broke out my old samsung tablet (2011 era) and it worked fine there.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Pos at best
customer_reviews.text: Geofence is sketchy at best. Contacted Honeywell and I was told that more than one mobile device can not be logged on at a time. That makes this worthless since I get home after my wife. She does not like a hot house for a couple of hours before I get home. Update-now it doesn't work at all unless i open the app, close it, open again, close it, open a third time and then i am magically home. Don't waste your money or time. Pos at best.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Pain!
customer_reviews.text: As a thermostat, works great. As a smart thermostat, it is mentally irregular. Connects to wifi, but not according to the app. The last step where it connects with Honeywell so you can access it remotely fails repeatedly. I have spent my career in HVAC controls and yet I am no match for this incredibly buggy interface. I hate to give up......But after hours of trying to win, I give!! Going back to whence it came! Stay Away!!!!! Returned and bought the senci smart stat. Took 5 minutes to setup as opposed to 5 hours with the Honeywell lyric T-5 and it even let me complete the setup and access it remotely too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I installed this myself. I am skilled in most DIY projects but was initially frustrated with this thermostat. I followed the instructions verbatim but my heat pump would not cool in cool mode. After double checking my wiring I called honeywell and although the wait time was excessive I spoke to a very knowledgeable technician that had me move one wire and everything worked. Went from summer cooling to fall heating without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: OldArmyVeteran

customer_reviews.title: Anything else but Honeywell
customer_reviews.text: Can't reliably connect to my network. Even their service people gave up. Dozens of devices connect all over my house. This one can't connect reliably 5 feet from my router. I've owned several honeywell thermostat and they all acted like connection to a network was the most obscure thing ever. I don't know why but really, this thing doesn't know anything about wireless connection. Prepare to work for hours to get it reconnected every time your power goes out
customer_reviews.author: Allen Claxton

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good!
customer_reviews.text: I would strongly recommend professional installation unless you are extremely handy. My HVAC pro took the better part of an hour, between mounting the unit and installing the C-wire onto my attic gas furnace. So far all is well, although I have not yet mastered all the intricacies of talking to the unit through Alexa. You have to learn what words it will accept for temperature settings, but when you get it right the unit works perfectly. I would think there's a way to enlarge the unit's vocabulary, but I haven't figured that out yet. But it seems an excellent buy for a smart thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbygeorge

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell Home Iphone App
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking easy to install and priced right. It works with Apple Home App. I am using the T5 in Saudi Arabia and unfortunately the Honeywell Home app is not available in Apple Store for Saudi Arabia. I tried to use the Honeywell App international version but no luck. I was not able to register the thermostat online. I wrote to Honeywell global no response. I wrote to Honeywell US and explained the case they referred me back to global!
customer_reviews.author: Khalid A. Alhuqail

customer_reviews.title: I wasted money on two of these !
customer_reviews.text: Normally I try to be constructive and just share what I learned so that that others may have an easier decision than I . However , my suggestion is to buy someone else’s brand . My units stopped connecting to the same network settings eight months after the warranty expired . I had to reach out to Honeywell via Facebook because the chat feature never connected and there isn’t a live person to speak with . The summary : failed after warranty term by 8 months , tech support was weak , fb rep had me reset modem , uninstall this and this and this and that for over one hour , I swear !
customer_reviews.author: Markmed31

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I installed this a few months ago. There was a $50 rebate from ConEd. I had the extra wire needed to supply constant power but had to hook it up at the furnace. The 20 year old Honeywell thermostat it replaced used batteries instead. Some back and forth until the thermostat hooked up with the WiFi router but OK after that. The iPhone app installed and works after creating a Honeywell Home account. The Alexa integration is OK too. You can ask Alexa to raise or lower the temperature. The installation was pretty straightforward. The plastic frame mounts to the wall and wires are attached. The thermostat pins then plug into the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I Love this thermostat. I bought this to replace my old dumb Honeywell and by chance had the C cable already. There was some issues when I set it up and it was not working like it was supposed to. I called Honeywell and told them that I was using a conventional heat and air system and they walked me through how to set it up correctly for my unit. Support was amazing and sat on the phone with me the whole time even waiting the 5 mins for the heat to kick on and then another 5 waiting for the air to start working. I would defiantly recommend Honeywell.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the reviews. This is ABSOLUTELY not worth it. This product only worked partially for 6 months. This gave me real issues with my home network and other devices running on Wi-Fi. It would disconnect itself all the time from the Wi-Fi, and Alexa would only occasionally work. I finally gave up when it would not read the correct temperature, and my HVAC would be running for over 3 hours. I bought the more expensive product that I originally wanted from another manufacturer. DO NOT WASTE YOU MONEY- this really was absolutely awful. I just wish I would have given up on this piece of junk sooner. TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it😢
customer_reviews.text: This was my second home to use this thermostat, blamed earlier issues on bad internet but continued to have problems with great internet. Kept on saying it was offline on apps while showing on line at the thermostat, spent hours on hold and with tech support asking me to do the same thing over and over evidently hoping for a different result 😢
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Works when its wants to
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two for my home, the 2nd floor one stop working intermittently after the warranty ended 8/2019 two years. Honeywell tech helped but was not able to get another to replaced. I've not brought a new one as it kept working intermittently. Well today it stop totally working. The one on the 1st floor works great, no issue. I have the lyric round in our home and one didn't work and lyric (honeywell) replaced it. My thoughts are do I get a different model or the same...but will definetly get the warranty extender from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mildred Toomey

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to replace Honeywell units that were not WIFI enabled
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 2 Honeywell 7 day programmable units with 2 of these. User interface needs major upgrading. App fails consistently, as in every time I adjust the units from my phone. Every. Time. Geofencing is difficult to manage with 2 users. Cheaper than Nest but a pain. Purchased because physical install was easy (replacing the same Honeywell thermostat w/o having to replace wall mounting or reconfigure wiring). Consider a different system imo.
customer_reviews.author: CSE

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself money and frustration buy a different brand!
customer_reviews.text: I originally voted this a 5 Star but it is 2:30 in the morning about a year after I bought this piece of crap and I’m done with it, I hate it! Honeywell just simply can’t make anything reliable anymore I guess so I’ll have to go buy a Chinese knock-off this get anything reliable. I’ve spent two stinking hours REPEATEDLY going through their da$ed setup screens and it won’t register. This thing constantly drops WiFi and almost never has worked for my wife’s phone on the GeoFence. Stay away from this piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: A Real Person

customer_reviews.title: Smart turned not so smart
customer_reviews.text: I was optimistic even after reading several reviews that it stops functioning after 2 days. Well sure enough it's 2 days after install and wifi no longer functioning and unable to register even after factory reset. Officially went from a smart thermostat to a not so smart one. The 2 days it worked it was flawless. Contacted Honywell and they stated they were unaware of any connectivity issues after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Danielb87

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set the temps both at the thermostat and remotely. Works great on Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I installed this along with a Honeywell THP9045A1023 to add the fourth wire for my two stage heat pump while it was 114F out. Took about an hour to install both the Honeywell THP9045A1023 and Lyric after spending another hour of preparation to map out the wiring. At first in blew out hot air due to me configuring the Lyric wrong because I did not choose heat pump. I like the look of the device and it is easy for family members to adjust the temperatures at the screen or on the phone. Would recommend spending time taking photos of the existing wire at both ends and not do it when is hot out.
customer_reviews.author: OMGI

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one with two houses
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They are simple and more or less reliable. I had one in my old condo. I say more or less because it seems that every once in a while a call for heat is not received by the furnace so I have to pull this thermostat off its mount and reseat it. Its not really a big deal unless i wasnt home for a week and it got below freezing in my house. maybe its a fluke or its a known issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Maksimik

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thermostat for my girlfriend about a year ago. She uses an Android phone. I have same thermostat but, use a IOS phone. Her thermostat has been very buggy since the day installed. Performance very inconsistent. About 2 weeks ago it went offline and we've not been able to get the problem fixed after spending hours on the phone with their tech support personnel. Finally, they said they would escalate the issue to their next tier support personnel and get back to us. After a few days they finally responded with a response to rest the thermostat. Something we've already done 20+ times. Very frustrating, will never buy another Honeywell product.
customer_reviews.author: JAM

customer_reviews.title: NOT Homekit compatible; terrible tech support
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. Neither worked with Homekit. Honeywell tech support is ridiculously ignorant of their products. I called three times. Twice I got someone who barely spoke English and knew nothing about Homekit. The final time I was connected with an American or Canadian English speaker who also did not know about the product. In all three cases, their attitude was unapologetically apathetic. They knew it didn’t work as advertised and there was nothing they could do about it. These specific thermostats do not work with Homekit, but I won’t be buying a Honeywell product ever again based upon their awful tech support.
customer_reviews.author: J. Trumps

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this item
customer_reviews.text: An easy "Smart Home" upgrade. Connected in a few minutes - had all required connectors so I didn't need to hunt around for any other wires from my furnace. Connected to Wifi and iPhone app and presto - works great. LOVE the Geo-fencing feature as I travel a lot. Now I don't have to worry if I'm wasting money and didn't turn down the air while I am away. Set radius (you can adjust it as needed) and 4 miles from my house, the unit goes into AWAY mode. 4 miles from home, get notification, I'm Back so AC going into Home mode.
customer_reviews.author: MadMac

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Great thermostat. My previous one was old and outdated. Fortunately I had a "C wire" which allowed me to use the Lyric to its full capabilities. The geofencing is great and very useful for me at least. I love the app, it is very user friendly. It is also capable of be using through Apple Home Kit. I basically say "Hey Siri, change the temperature to 72°" and it works flawlessly. Great purchase. I highly recommend it. Oh and the installation was straight forward. Make sure you know what kind of system you have for example: Heat Pump, OBV on cool/heat etc.. If you don't know, call tech support from Lyric, they are very helpful and patient.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Horvath

customer_reviews.title: android app not ready
customer_reviews.text: Nice thermostat - easy to install and configure from touch screen. The honeywell app, running on a Google Pixel 3 Android 10 is another story. It's flakey - complains about no internet connectivity, but works fine if i stop and start the app again. Tech support indicated in a chat that not all phones have been tested for compatibility. If that is correct, then I am an unwilling beta tester for their software. In my opinion, either the app should test the phone for compatibility when it is installed, or the app should not be widely distributed in the Play Store without a warning about compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: bert

customer_reviews.title: WIFi problems
customer_reviews.text: Tried for a few months. Keeps getting disconnected from the WiFi, although I see full bars on the thermostat. I called the company and they told me to take it off the wall and reconnect. Worked first time, but after that, even taking off the wall and reconnecting it back did not work. I have wasted too many hours on this device.
customer_reviews.author: Shahid J. Hayat

customer_reviews.title: Glad I pulled the trigger and automated!
customer_reviews.text: I waited several years trying to decide if I really needed one of these or not. My daughter has three of them in her (great big) house, and they love them. I did have it installed by someone who has worked in air conditioning for a while so I can’t speak for ease of installation. I did set up the Alexa interface and it was easy. FYI: I messed up on the setup because I was unsure if I had a heat pump or not and had to completely start over when it wouldn’t work. It has been fun to tell Alexa to “set my thermostat on 74 degrees”. Lazy knows no bounds at my house🤣. You won’t be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing buy so far.
customer_reviews.text: Super awesome buy. Looks modern and is easy to configure. The hardest part is tucking the wires into the wall since it’s a small profile behind the thermostat. I did run into the issue of the AC on cool but blowing hot air. This was due to the initial configuration where I needed my unit System Type set to Heat Pump versus Conventional. That was it and it works perfect. Geofencing is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Skytalon74

customer_reviews.title: No customer support available
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to replace a Honeywell non-wifi thermostat and assumed the system would be compatible. Unfortunately when it was set to cool, the heat turned on. I figured there might be an easy explanation so I called the Honeywell help number posted on their website. I was treated to the following message: "Due to high volume of calls we are not able to take your call right now. Please call again later." and the system hung up on me. It's possible a fix could have been found but I'm not interested in a smart product that has no support from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Island

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with 4 wire systems
customer_reviews.text: If your heating system does not have the required ‘c’ wire already available forget this thermostat. The effort to get it to work with your heater will require either a strong knowledge of electrical circuitry on your part or you’ll have to bring in a licensed professional. By the time you spend the extra money, you might as well buy a Nest thermostat which what I did. Simple and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleNicks

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Thermostat!!
customer_reviews.text: I had only 15mins before having to run out on an errand and I figured well at least I'd get started on replacing my existing thermostat with the Honeywell RCHT8621WF T5. Really simply installation - take picture of the existing wires configuration, always better to do so you can put things back to together if need be. Got done in the 15mins! took another 10mins from there to do the WiFi configuration and Alexa skill addition - very happy with it, now I don't have to run downstairs to change the temperature if it gets too warm/cold --- all done through Alexa/Voice control now
customer_reviews.author: *J*H*

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold temp
customer_reviews.text: This started out good but after a few days of service it stopped reaching the desired cool to temperature. My previous 'dumb' thermostat did so just fine and so does the nest downstairs. It may just be worth it to spend some more $'s and move up to the higher grade ones like nest as the T5 fell short. The app is not very good and support isn't very helpful -- I called support and they told me to put my phone on airplane mode which disconnected the call -- hilarious. after a system reset of the thermostat everything went haywire -- the app quit working and I just have given up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amozite

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and control temperature at thermostat or anywhere in world
customer_reviews.text: We recently went to Europe and it was very nice to be able to see what the temp was in our house, and change the temp or the temperature program from there. The program is flexible and allows you to set different temps at different times of the day. We live in the desert, and like to lower the temp at night to 82 and raise it to 86 during the day when we aren't home. That way the A/C uses very little energy. If our house-cleaner is coming, I set it to 78 for the day. This thermostat also allows you to set it easily by touching it--unlike some brands.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: The manual which came with this is all screwed up with pages completely out of order and some pages even upside down (100% not on purpose). Otherwise, I would give this 5 stars (so far). It linked to my Alexa so easily after I downloaded its app. I think some people think it doesn't always work, but I don't think they realize it comes factory defaulted with a schedule that you need to re-program in order to keep the temp normal. For instance, if you leave the area it thinks you left the house and sets the temp to 85 cool. Just set it not to do that, which is very easy, and you will be happy with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking thermostat. Easy to install (if you know how to add a c wire or already have one) and very easy set up. The app is great too. Love the geo fence feature. Makes learning t stats obsolete. Excellent purchase for the price when compared to other name brand wifi thermostats. Will buy another for my basement cooling unit soon
customer_reviews.author: WilVas

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: basically a wifi thermostat that is compatible with alexa and i think a few other voice controlled devices like googles. I like this because i can control temps away from home, or turn stuff on and off when i want like if the dog is inside and it's a hot day. Then you can turn on the air or whole house fan if they're hooked up. This thermostat requires 4 wires, so the older 3 wire hook ups dont work with this. has a travel mode too to check for 2 cell phones, if they're both detected as far away, it turns off the heating/cooling system.
customer_reviews.author: MalekoTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a C-wire!!!
customer_reviews.text: So... when I got this, I was ready to wire it up and go. BUT IT WILL NOT WORK UNLESS YOU HAVE A C-WIRE. I got the adapter that did not come with it for free since you’re allowed to order one with this. Comes with a inside coupon. But even then, it didn’t work. I ended up going down to my furnace and switching the FAN wire over to the C-Wire terminal. And then going back to the fan wire at the thermostat (which is the same wire) and installing it into the C-Wire slot. Because who the heck runs it on fan only? Lol. And it worked! But they don’t tell you all that in their pamphlet.
customer_reviews.author: Adam X

customer_reviews.title: I should've known to avoid Honeywell
customer_reviews.text: Just bought two of these and either they are both defective something else is wrong that I don't understand. Not matter what I set the temperature to they refuse to hold it. They either let the house heat up to over 15 degrees what I set it for or let it cool off more then 15 degrees. It then kicks the fan on for about 3 minutes. Temperature never moves and then it shuts off. Still telling me that cooling or heating is happening. I've gone through the entire manual, looked at forum posts on this issue and I can't find anything about it. At this point I'm going to go back to my old thermostats and replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Eric O.

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY!!
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of users. I had issues connecting this thermostat to my Network as well. Honeywell tech support was useless. They kept saying there was something wrong with my router. Hummm🤔.. A router that everything else is connected to and working? I THINK NOT..The only way to get it to work PROPERLY, is to purchase another router. NO THNX. That's NOT the way it works. Spend the extra money on a better Thermostat and save yourself the headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo A. Vides

customer_reviews.title: Works great for keeping the temperature at 50 degrees or higher
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple system that should work well for most people, but it may not work for me because it appears I can’t select a temperature below 50 degrees. I installed it in my garage in western Montana where I am only concerned with keeping the temperature above freezing when I am gone for long periods of time, so keeping the temperature at 50 or above will waste too much energy. For a “normal” home environment that isn’t a problem, but in my case I may have to replace it with a thermostat that can regulate the heat at a lower temperature.
customer_reviews.author: BeemerPilot

customer_reviews.title: Simply Great
customer_reviews.text: I delayed my purchase of a smart thermostat until I read the Consumer Report review of this one. It priced right and works great (on my dual-stage heating -- won't know about cooling until spring). It was easy to install -- and I needed to figure out the 'C' wire. The Alexa integration is spiffy as is the geopositioning (automatically turns down the heat when you leave your home). Don't let the absence of a 'C' wire scare you . . . chances are that the wire bundle will have extra unused wires. It was easy to hook up on both the thermostat and furnace sides.
customer_reviews.author: Shintaz

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell in name only,  generic garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Spent 3 hours installing this device. The app integration was tedious and painful. A call to tech support listed in the manual yielded an hour of wasted time and a subsequent call to honeywell similarly a qaste of time, because the product isnt supported or produced by Honeywell, its only branded by Honeywell. Once I tried for the 20th time I was able to get the system to connect. Once it was up and running and 80 deg in my home I kicked it to cool. After some time it was quite warm and noticed the heat was pumping through the ducts. I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: ThatGvy

customer_reviews.title: No tech support - just referrals to professional installers
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped to have a programable thermostat that could be controlled from my phone. Only in the promotional material apparently. Downloading the 'app' produces a picture of a room in a house - nothing more! No buttons, no activity, just a picture. Like the old fashioned thermostats you can stand at the device, touch it and change the temperature, but is it really worth $150 for that? The confusing website for 'Resideo' the name of the spin-off company that capitalizes on the Honeywell name is only good for ordering more products. With service like this I give the company another couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Nordquist

customer_reviews.title: Issues in 1 yr.
customer_reviews.text: so i bought device back in June 2019. Worked great. My issue is now it will not go below 76 degrees. The ac has been running alday. When I go into the app and change desire temp from 74 to 75 degrees it mysteriously went to the the desire temp, but air was still running.so I o changed it again to 77. And bam turned off, now I'm its about 12am and im droping the temp to 75 degrees. And now im stuck at 76. Might need a new 1 but idk if imma go with the same brand.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Perea

customer_reviews.title: Great product, now that I have it installed properly....
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy once I figured out what kind of system I had installed in my home. KNOW what you have and check the wiring compatibility on the Honeywell web site. It's really helpful. My blind wife can now voice control the thermostat to her liking. I've also got some Alexa compatible light switches and doorbell so she has some confidence and control over her environment.
customer_reviews.author: GentlemanJames

customer_reviews.title: Hardware is good. Honeywell Home app needs a heavy upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 and works well. Works well manually. The Honeywell Home app software is a different story. I have slightly different type of home wireless network. Have a primary router and a wireless bridge setup with the same SSID beaming 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz. My phones see only one SSID and not it switched and smart select the best frequency available at any given point in the house. But this app setting the system unable to resolve this smart selection. ONLY works on 2.4Ghz wireless frequency. Personally speaking the geofencing is not that useful for me as I work only 1 mile away from home. Need to try connecting to
customer_reviews.author: BNR

customer_reviews.title: works well, our microwave seems to cause it to lose wifi connectivity
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat works well and looks good on the wall. The app works pretty well too -- we particularly like the geofencing feature and the ability to control the thermostat remotely. The only nit is that the thermostat occasionally loses wifi connectivity and eventually it is able to re-establish the connection. (This happens mostly when we're using our microwave. However, other wifi connected devices seem to be able to deal with it.)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Newsome

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: The app is nice and easy to use when the device is connected to your network. I had to return the first one after three weeks because it refused to connect to any wifi network. Tried calling tech support and was on hold for an hour before I gave up. Information online is minimal. The thermostat lacks normal features like temperature offset. Otherwise it is easy to install, set-up, and use. I would probably look at a more advanced model.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J.

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermosat for the Auto Heat/Cool. Easy installation as we already had a base model Honeywell thermostat in use. Easy to use wall display. The options are endless in comparison to the base model Honeywell thermostat the T-5 replaced. The Honeywell app is convenient and so far works without error. I can genuinely say I am impressed with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I decided on the Honeywell product because my AC supplier had installed a non WIFI Honeywell device and the wiring was the same for the WIFI model. The WIFI model connects with Alexia and works well to change temperature for both heating and cooling. This was particularly helpful for my wife who has a vision impairment. There maybe other devices that offer more function but the Honeywell device does the job. If have not needed tech support.
customer_reviews.author: G. McGrath

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's fine ... but it sometimes doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat itself is pretty nice, the interface (touch screen) is easy to use and fairly intuitive. However the mobile app is ABSOLUTE GARBAGE!!!! For no apparent reason the Thermostat will just disappear from the Honeywell app and getting it to resync is nearly impossible. I've tried six times tonight, and it KEEPS getting stuck. I would advise against buying this product, though it works good most of the time ... the frustration of getting it to work again is just not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jason McConnell

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted this thermostat to work.
customer_reviews.text: Thermostats should be easy to install but this one would never work right. Wiring it up was simple but during the programming it has a lot of fairly technical questions you must answer. Honeywell tech support was nonexistent as far as I could tell. Had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Rockdoc

customer_reviews.title: Simple smart thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Does what I want it to, allows Google home integration and remote access without a ton of features I don't care about. Reasonable price. Setup took a few tries...you initially connect to the built in wifi, and when it transitioned to the house wifi it failed a few times, but I persevered and it took eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Josef R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I began using this device using the Honeywell app with geofencing and scheduling capabilities. I also linked it to my Apple Homekit. After a while i abandoned the Honeywell app which requires you to re-authenticate often for the simplicity of the Apple HomeKit. It works well and i really don't have any complaints about the thermostat. We had a new HVAC system installed and i decided to go with this and it works. Great thing about using HomeKit and I would assume the other automation products is that your schedule information and scenes are saved in that environment so it's a snap
customer_reviews.author: Firewall Guy

customer_reviews.title: Product is junk, over priced at any price, tech support is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat has never worked correctly, even after 5 calls to tech support. Geo fencing is non functional. It does not sense when we are away. Interface is clunky and outdated. The app on an Android phone has glitches ie. Cant "see" the internet signal even when in the same room. NO satisfaction on attempts for replacement/return.
customer_reviews.author: geofarm

customer_reviews.title: Everything I need.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great thermostat. I set it for 70, and it keeps the room at 70. This may seem like a no brainier, but a thermostat has to be pretty clever to pull this off. Honeywell utizizes their "adaptive intelligent recovery" tech to pull this off and it works flawlessly. This would be a no frills smart thermostat. None of the bells and whistles that you don't need, but all of the smarts that you do need. It's also very nice looking on the wall. Looks like money to me. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: D. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Good cheaper alternative to the Nest
customer_reviews.text: Pretty darn good, although not as intuitive as a Nest thermostat. Works well enough and I got it at a great price so I really can't complain. One thing to note when installing the unit, it can take up to 5 minutes before your AC compressor unit will kick on. Shortly after installing this, I was stumped as to why the compressor failed to come on and I was only getting the fan. I called Honeywell support and they helped verify the connected wires. In the end I just needed to be patient and wait a good 5 minutes before the compressor eventually kicked in. It is a built-in safety mechanism to protect the AC unit.
customer_reviews.author: chiguy312

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay connected to Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: Bought this model and brand to save some money, but I really wish we had spent the extra. It was fairly simple to install but it will not stay connected to the wifi. We have quite a few smart products in our home and nothing else disconnects like this thing. Now, you are still able to use it manually but who wants to do that?? I bought a smart thermostat for a reason. I have tried multiple times to contact Honeywell customer support and they were not helpful at all.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper101

customer_reviews.title: Great, smart thermostat for half the price of comparable ...
customer_reviews.text: Great, smart thermostat for half the price of comparable units. I had an old 4 wire thermostat hooked up, but luckily there were more wires hidden in the wall so I just hooked up the extra wire this required to my unit and everything worked fine. One major upgrade this thing needs is to be able to use the 5ghz frequency. For people who live in large condo/apartment buildings like myself the 2.4ghz frequency kinda sucks due to overlapping signals from the 400 other residents. So it occasionally causes connection loss. 5ghz frequency is much better at handling signal interference.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I own a single stage heating/cooling unit and have a router from my cable provider and install was easy enough. I called Honeywell and they helped me set it up. Use the Honeywell Home app and not the other app for the Lyric T5. I love it so far. Modern and minimalist. I used the Honeywell Wiresaver module as I didn’t have a C wire and the install was really easy and everything works as it should including the fan modes. I bought mine slightly used and it looks brand new. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Choice!
customer_reviews.text: I consulted with 3 different H-VAC persons and really researched this. We have a Apple Home and this product was compatible. Honeywell has it's own virtual interface including phone Apps making this a stand alone product without needing a smart home system. I was leery about going with a smart thermostat from an unfamiliar brand and heard they can be problematic at times. Honeywell is well respected in terms of thermostats and has great specs. But more importantly the folks that install them (H-VAC) recommended this brand. This model is also visually appealing.
customer_reviews.author: ACeducator

customer_reviews.title: Good thermostat bad App
customer_reviews.text: The thermostat by itself works great, and I'd a great deal for a smart thermostat. Unfortunately I could not get the app to integrate with it at all. I tried everything but nothing would work. If that is what your looking for then I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannen

customer_reviews.title: Fiasco
customer_reviews.text: I’m so mad that I had to send this to bed after taking weeks of research the purchase. Turns out the one I was sent had a faulty wire according to our AC professional and it blew out a piece on our air condition which cost over $200 to fix. I sent this back to Amazon and it took a month to get my money back after promising a new one for weeks. Decided to let my dream of having a smart thermostat go for now. Unsure if I’ll try again after this fiasco!
customer_reviews.author: buyitnowgrl

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works great. The problem arises with the first power outage or internet outage. This thermostat will NOT reconnect to your wifi and you will end up setting up the wifi EVERY time you have a burp in service. I contacted Honeywell support and they basically said routers often take longer to reboot than the thermostat and if the thermostat doesn't find the wifi right away it quits trying. I run probably 20 honeywell thermostats between homes and work. I've been very happy with their products up until this point. The t-5's are simply junk.
customer_reviews.author: BillM

customer_reviews.title: Wifi is difficult to configure
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to connect to wifi. I have 18 years experience in IT.. I had to call Honeywell for help. 2 units later and 3 calls to Honeywell, I now have a Nest. All other aspects of the unit is good, but I bought the thermostat to controll remotely.
customer_reviews.author: xotox1

customer_reviews.title: Best $100 and change I've ever spent
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about installing it, but the instructions were very thorough without being overwhelming. It did take me a couple tries of playing with the settings to get it working as I didn't know the HVAC lingo they needed to know. But once I had it configured, it's been my favorite improvement to our home. Next home we buy, I'll have another one ordered before we even move in. Being able to control it with a great, simple, very straightforward touch screen is a plus. But the mobile app is the best part. Simple, easy, works. And for nearly nine months now, no issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Caris

customer_reviews.title: Internet part sucks
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hook up (when you have the right wires). Pretty easy to setup (when you know the type of heater you have) but the internet connection was a pain in the butt. Took me 4hrs to get the thermostat network to connect to my internet. I did like other users suggested and tuned my phone on mode plane. Not sure it helped. After 4 hrs trying it finally accessed my internet. I don't think I did anything different. I think the app wasn't working properly and I couldn't access the next page after the internet connection part. I kept on returning on the "choose the type of thermostat"
customer_reviews.author: Bella Lacazotte

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the correct wiring!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent thermostat. Word of caution for DIY installers! Make sure you read the wiring diagrams and follow those instructions to the letter! If you don’t, you may pop the fuse on you heater’s circuit board. I did! $5 purchase. After I corrected the proper wiring install everything worked great! C-Wire converter works great. I am extremely please with this unit at this price. Also works great with Apple HomeKit.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price...
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an upgrade to the basic thermostat i had and just didnt wantbto soend $200+. We had just gotten an Echo Dot so this integration was a bonus. I paid to have it installed, set up was fairly easy, a bit of a kerfuffle with the wigi connecting but 3rd time was the charm. Installed app on phones and was able to set it up. Very cool. Being able to tell Alexa to adjust the temp is kind of fun...lol...
customer_reviews.author: Todd Young

customer_reviews.title: Does not play well with WiFi- UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Nice presentation and good organization of the user interface on both the app and the thermostat but consistently disconnects from the network and have spent so much time with tech support to get it to reconnected that it’s no longer worth the trouble. Sending it back and starting again with another TBD product.- Honeywell support finally identified that the themostat I had was defective and authorized a replacement. Amazon shipped the replacement quickly and I shipped the defective unit back. With the new one things are working just fine. It hasn't lost the wi-fi one time since it was installed in Feb 2019 (written May 8 2019)
customer_reviews.author: Alan E. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Was my fault... Blamed device first.. Operator error!
customer_reviews.text: Once an account was established with Honeywell using "Honeywell Home Lifestyle " ( Apple Apps Store.) all went smoothly, the connection to house Apple router was effortless. The challenge was knowing the type of heat/cooling source I have, as there are questions in the setup that are crucial for the Lyric T5 to work correctly. Once all was configured correctly all worked fine.. Can not comment on geofencing as I have no use for it at this point. The purpose for getting this thermostat was to turn the heat on prior to arriving a vacation home.
customer_reviews.author: A_Uzer

customer_reviews.title: easy to install and works good.
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed it, I had some trouble keeping it connected to the wifi. after a while it worked fine. I am guessing it was getting updates. Also, it was running too many cycles and keeping the house about 5 degrees warmer than I set it to be. It seems to be adapting and working better now. It is still about 1 degree warmer than the setting. I installed it 3 days ago. It is nice to get into bed and then tell the Alexa to turn down the heat. Much nicer than getting out of bed to check it! I haven't tried the geofencing yet.
customer_reviews.author: Vermontguy

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: this product took a few minutes for me to install but at no fault of the product. the instructions for setting up the wiring were well written and easy to follow. it took me 2 tries to get it to turn on correctly but that is going to be blamed on the previous thermostat installer. problems connecting to the internet at first but I let it sit over night and it suddenly started working, my router is very close to the unit itself so I cant speak about the wifi range. all around good product so far, i would recommend for the price,
customer_reviews.author: Joel Koenigsmark and Shayla Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and simple to use by any party!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, setup is simple can get it going without a phone, iot integration requires the Home app. I replaced my old mechanical thermostat with this smart thermostat and replaced the wiring going to the HVAC controls. This items comes with an adapter to allow for integration of the system without the 'C' wire, however I opted to put an entire new cable so I have the option to upgrade the system in the future when my existing system becomes exhausted.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon, The Technical Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!! Tells you when the family is close, lol
customer_reviews.text: A little troubleshooting on the wires for install but only had to move the wires once. Integrated well, after 2nd try had both my wife and my phone working with the temp. It’s a great way to know when your wife gets home, lol. Geofencing works great, Alexa interacts well, I didn’t get frustrated once with this setup. Somethings take 2-3 tries or more. This was pretty easy to get setup and schedule going.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia McCall

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Hook up was easy AFTER I read the schematic of my AC unit. I had to color code my wiring (as previous installer had no use for color codes) In doing so I found the C wire. Previous installer thought green was a prettier color then brown. drove me nuts til I climbed on the roof! After hook up (2 hours to get wired do to previous installer) The Geofence is spot on, I drive 500 yards from home system shuts down, I come home. system running! We are running 100 degrees and temps are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Idiot from Az

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with Alexa anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t use with Alexa anymore. This used to work, but people like to fix the Nd a that aren’t broken and they changed everything including forcing us to use a new app. Now Alexa can’t even find the thermostat. What is the point of having a smart thermostat if you can’t use its smart features? Now it’s just like any other thermostat except I paid more for this
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R Earley

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Tried to install myself, but the c wire needed to be connected at the a/c unit on the roof. Called an a/c tech and they got it working. The most difficult part was connecting to my wifi 2.4 ghz. A tip I used, put phone in airplane mode, connect to thermostat wifi, as connecting to your home wifi, press the wps button on the router. Then it worked after 2 failed attempt, don't give up. The app does disconnect but remember your 4 digit number, and it re-connects no problem. Signed up for $150 gas/electric rebates for switching over. It literally pays you to upgrade your system! Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and operate, great with Siri
customer_reviews.text: So far we like it! Installed 2 days ago and works like a champ. The installation was very easy, they guide you step by step. Same for the setup, probably 20min all together. The app is nice, it naturally pairs with Siri and HomeKit which is what I really wanted. I also like how you can create different accounts for the family so the geofencing works for everyone. Overall very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Antoine

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre device
customer_reviews.text: The geofencing is a failure for me. My daily activities are too close to home for it to work properly. The setup was a total pain and frustrating. I had to call tech support because it asked me questions about my heat pump that I did not know. It's a good programmable thermostat that I can access with my phone, but minus one star each for failures on the geofencing and setup.
customer_reviews.author: ShaneJ

customer_reviews.title: I was pleased that was open on Sunday AM
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I have two thermostats both paired with Alexa. Had problem with initially pairing the thermostat. It is not obvious to pair the thermostat initially with my smartphone and then pair it with the wi fi. You will need to pair your phone with the thermostat network. The thermostat provides the network name. After pairing with the phone, the setup is consistent with other wi fi devices. I did need to talk to Honeywell support. I was pleased that was open on Sunday AM. The support person had good english skills. The first thermostat took two hours to complete but the second took only 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Terrell

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit to work out the wiring for my two stage heating and cooling, but overall its working well, particularly for the price (local power company offered a rebate for energy efficient devices). My existing thermostat was programmable, but being many years old did not have wifi capability nor of course compatibility with Alexa or Apple Home devices. I use the T5 with Alexa and works well for simple commands like "set temperature to..." which is precisely why I got this new stat' as nothing beats turning up the heat from a warm bed before getting up on a cold morning....:-)
customer_reviews.author: fester

customer_reviews.title: Hi tech wifi Thermostat that is very easy to use on a daily basis. 1-day Prime delivery
customer_reviews.text: This T5 Thermostat is easier to use than the old analog dial-type that we replaced. The menu is very intuitive, and is one level deep for all primary functions. Highly recommend this product because of Honeywell technology, quality, and reliability. The C-wire connection required tech support for connecting Thermostat to HVAC unit, in my case. Don't let this hold you back from purchasing. Tech support is outstanding and will very quickly assist with the proper connection of thermostat. This unit is well worth taking a couple minutes for the connection, as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love being able to adjust from phone. Nice when you forget to adjust temp when you are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great idea to fine tune your home comfort
customer_reviews.text: Handsome design and pretty easy to hook up. Took about 15 minutes to install. App is pretty easy to use but I prefer the apple Home connectivity because everything is all in one place. You can set up a calendar and thresholds when you want either air or heat to kick in. You can fine tune it to when your home or not. You can control it while your away for pets or keeping kids from changing it. Also helpful because you can have house cooled off before you get home.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: A must read if you're having problems completing setup
customer_reviews.text: If you are having failure to complete setup message at the end when it links to your router. Be aware. Your router password MUST BE alphanumeric. After 10 attempts and failures I went to some notes I got from another Amazon user who got them from Honeywell tech. (I've attached a screenshot) once I updated my password and swapped the symbols out to letters I had success on my first re-try. Also make note to check your security protocol. There are 2 that won't work with the T-5.
customer_reviews.author: PFD Jr

customer_reviews.title: Works great, wireless function and app/Alexa work awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It works like a charm. Controls the temperature very well, and the wireless function has proven to be extremely convenient. I don’t test the accuracy of the thermostat to actual temp in the room, but I can say that it keeps me right where I want to be for maximum comfort. Telling Alexa to turn the heat up early morning is awesome! It’s also nice to check the temp when away on vacation as well. Then to set it to where I want it on the way home is another plus.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie

customer_reviews.title: Both are working great
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these for my rental townhome that has two AC units that were controlled by old-fashioned thermostats. Since it was a rental, I didn't want to spring for fancier units, but I still wanted solid remote control and Alexa integration. Both worked great and can be controlled from Alexa, the Honeywell Home app and even Apple Home. A good solid unit at a good value.
customer_reviews.author: George D. Everitt

customer_reviews.title: Great with Siri, but Alexa didn’t do as I told her to.
customer_reviews.text: A few months in and so far it’s great. It’s app is easy. Works great with Siri. Used it once with Alexa by telling her to “turn off the thermostat”, Alexa responded with “okay, I will change the temperature settings to ...........”. I immediately revoked her controlling privileges to this unit. Siri doesn’t change the settings on its app, It just says “ok” and shuts off.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Duck

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Purcahse
customer_reviews.text: We tried for a month to get these to connect to their app. We even changed internet service and speed...nothing helped. We returned and went with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: RevSnoopy

customer_reviews.title: Finally get control of the thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: A great price and great performance. I did have to figure out how to get power to the unit from the furnace as the 5th wire was already in use by another furnace accessory (humidifier), but a little bit of work on google and it worked immediately. I like the option to put the HVAC on “circulate” to move air around even if the heater or AC isn’t needed; evens out the air temperature in a multi-storey house. Great when traveling to let the temperature rise or fall without paying to keep the house a perfect temperature when nobody is home. Geofencing feature is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: LP28

customer_reviews.title: Great for HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my T5+ so far (about 1 month)! I was looking for a HomeKit-enabled thermostat that can tell when nobody is home. The T5+ does a really good job of tracking all of our phones and switching between home and away modes. Control through HomeKit is fairly reliable. Only occasionally does it appear unavailable in the Home app, and tapping the icon usually reconnects it. I used to have a Nest, which worked well but didn't integrate with HomeKit. I tried the thermostat from iDevices, but it doesn't do anything smart based on whether anyone is home; it only controls the temp. Ecobee behaved unpredictably for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this
customer_reviews.text: Read the directions and installed in a few minutes the alexa integration took a little bit but now I can tell her to raise or lower the temp with ease. Since it is in the hallway and I can’t see it all the time it makes it nice laying in bed and tell her to cool the house down and not have to go across the house to adjust the thermostat. Everyone married couple needs one, might save a few heavy sighs when he gets up to change the temp for her.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great after I switched to mesh Wifi at home
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in my bedroom and it dropped connection like crazy with my 4 year old Linksys router. It just never worked right and won't even connect to my phone from time to time. However, all the issue went away when I replaced the router with the Netgear Orbi Mesh wifi routers. Super stable in my 2 zone AC system at home. I guess it really needs strong consistent wifi to function properly. II will buy one more to replace my downstairs thermostat..
customer_reviews.author: WRXTotoro

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly pissed. I bought this a month ago because I wanted to be able to access from cell phone. Worked great! Then, yesterday, I saw my bill from Georgia Power, $441.00. After I came down off the ceiling, I began doing a little checking. Seems that I have been running on Emergency Heat all month. The heat pump never came into play. Pulled this peace of doggie doo out and put my old stat back and everything works as it is supposed to. That was a damned expensive lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!  EASY installation and integration with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent installation guide made for an easy upgrade from our existing thermostat. Thermostat connected to our network without issue, and the Lyric app made integration with Alexa a snap! Once hardware was installed, we had Alexa controlling it in under FIVE MINUTES. Would recommend to others wanting to interface with Alexa. AND on top of this, we got a REBATE from our Gas Company!!! Great all around!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: A Believer

product_meta.title: Honeywell Home RCHT8610WF2006/W T5 Lyric Round Wi-Fi Thermostat, Black
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately).
Product requires C-Wire, unit will not work without it.
Control your Smart Home with Amazon Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately) and Apple HomeKit with voice control using Siri, the Apple voice assistant

7-Day Flexible Scheduling or Location Based Temperature control (GeoFencing). Uses geofencing technology to keep track of your smart phone's location;Auto changeover: The Lyric T5 can be set to determine if the home's system should be in heating or cooling mode to provide maximum comfort

Adaptive recovery learns how long it takes to achieve the right temperature at the right time and automatically runs your system to get to your desired temperature when you want it, with auto change from heat to cool
Smart Alerts - push notifications for filter changes and extreme temperature warnings keeps you informed

Energy Star Certified.The Lyric T5 Wi-Fi thermostat is compatible with most single-stage and multi-stage conventional and heat pump heating and cooling systems. Provides remote thermostat control through iOS or Android smartphones and tablets. Compatible with Apple HomeKit and Amazon Echo
